meanings.definition: A person or thing that decelerates.
meanings.sent1: The decelerators on the playground make sure children slow down before reaching the slide.
meanings.sent2: The car's brakes act as decelerators, helping it stop safely at traffic lights.
meanings.sent3: The decelerators, also known as the 'slowpokes', always make everyone late to the party.
meanings.sent4: Her calming presence was like a decelerator for his racing thoughts.
meanings.sent5: The decelerators in the movie were like the anchors holding back the speeding train.

meanings.definition: A device or mechanism that slows down the speed of something.
meanings.sent1: The decelerators on the treadmill help control the pace of the workout.
meanings.sent2: The parachute acted as a decelerator, reducing the speed of the falling object.
meanings.sent3: The decelerators in the race were so effective that the cars almost stopped mid-track.
meanings.sent4: The decelerators in the roller coaster ride made the thrilling experience more manageable.
meanings.sent5: The decelerators in the elevator prevented sudden stops and starts, ensuring a smooth ride.
